meaning: When something is arduous, it demands great effort or labor.

tasks.text: The explorers began their {{hard}} hike up the steep mountain.
Studying for the medical exam was an {{exhausting}} process.
Climbing Mount Everest is an {{extremely tough}} challenge.

meaning: To attain something means to gain or achieve it, often after a lot of effort.

tasks.text: In two more years, I will {{get}} my high school diploma.
She finally {{achieved}} her goal of becoming a lawyer.
The mountain climbers managed to {{reach}} the summit after many hours.

meaning: To coexist with something means to exist with it in the same time and place.

tasks.text: Our pets {{live}} at our home with little or no problems.
Different cultures can {{exist together}} peacefully in one city.
The ancient ruins {{stood together}} with the modern buildings.

meaning: To conceive something means to be able to imagine or believe it.

tasks.text: The child could not {{imagine}} the actual size of the Earth.
It was hard to {{believe}} that she had won the competition.
The author {{created}} the idea for his new novel during a walk.

meaning: When something or someone is dubious, they are not considered honest.

tasks.text: The police thought that the man’s description of the crime was {{not honest}}.
The offer sounded {{uncertain}} and risky to investors.
She gave him a {{questionable}} look after hearing his excuse.

meaning: An ego is a person’s sense of their own worth.

tasks.text: Kelly’s {{self-worth}} made her think that she was some kind of a superhero.
His huge {{self-image}} caused him to argue with everyone.
She let her {{pride}} get in the way of apologizing.

meaning: Elastic is a rubber that stretches when it is pulled.

tasks.text: He attached the {{stretchy}} bungee to his legs before he jumped off the platform.
The {{flexible}} band snapped back when stretched too far.
The fabric is {{stretchable}}, making it perfect for sportswear.

meaning: An endeavor is an attempt to do something, especially something new or original.

tasks.text: The company’s new advertising {{attempt}} ended in a horrible failure.
Starting his own business was a brave {{effort}}.
Her charitable {{project}} helped many people in need.

meaning: To engrave means to cut a design or words into the surface of something.

tasks.text: The couple {{carved}} their names onto the old pine tree.
The artist {{cut}} a design into the stone tablet.
He asked the jeweler to {{etch}} their initials on the ring.

meaning: To excavate means to dig on land and remove dirt to look for something.

tasks.text: The team wishes to {{dig}} the site in hopes of finding fossils.
Workers began to {{remove dirt}} from the construction site.
Archaeologists plan to {{uncover}} the ancient ruins buried in the sand.
